channel.title: Daily Tedium on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Daily Tedium on My New Hugo Site

item.title: The Difficult Second Album
item.description: [big]Testing 1, 2, 3: Two years ago, Tedium got its start based on what I like to call the “difficult second album” theory. “The cliche that you have a lifetime to make your first album and only a year or two to make your second holds true,” The Guardian’s Dorian Lynskey wrote back in 2003 of this basic concept, in the context of The Strokes, whose second album wasn’t actually all that difficult.
